text: Daniel Toroitich arap Moi (2 September 1924 - 4 February 2020) was a Kenyan politician. He served as the 2nd President of Kenya from 1978 to 2002. He also served as the country's 3rd Vice President from 1967 to 1978. Moi was popularly known to Kenyans as "Nyayo", a Swahili word for "footsteps". He earned this name because they thought he was following the footsteps of the first President. Moi was born in Kurieng'wo village, Sacho division, Baringo County on 2 September 1924. Moi died at a Nairobi hospital on 4 February 2020 at the age of 95. He had Alzheimer's disease and was recently hospitalized for multiple organ failure. ==References== ==Other websites== * Moi Africa Institute * State House Kenya Profile of Daniel Toroitich arap Moi Category:1924 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Presidents of Kenya Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:People with Alzheimer's disease Category:Vice presidents of Kenya
title: Daniel arap Moi
